revision.text:
{{Use Indian English|date=July 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2015}} {{Infobox film | name = Baadshaho | image = Ajay Devgn's Baadshaho.JPG | alt = | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Milan Luthria]] | producer = {{unbulleted list|[[Bhushan Kumar]]||Milan Luthria}} | writer = [[Rajat Arora]] | starring = {{unbulleted list|[[Ajay Devgn]]|[[Emraan Hashmi]]|[[Ileana D'Cruz]]|[[Esha Gupta]]|[[Sanjay Mishra (actor)|Sanjay Mishra]]|[[Vidyut Jammwal]]| [[Priyanshu Chatterjee]]}} | music = {{unbulleted list|[[R.D. Burman]]|[[Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan]]|[[Tanishk Bagchi]]|[[Ankit Tiwari]]|John Stewart Eduri ([[Film score|background score]])}} | cinematography = Sunita Radia | editing = [[Aasif Sheikh]] | studio = {{unbulleted list|[[T-Series (company)|T-Series]]|Vertex Motion Pictures}} | distributor = {{unbulleted list|Mangl Murti Films<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/sangeeta-ahir-to-distribute-baadshaho-nationally/articleshow/59986211.cms"Sangeeta|title=Ahir to distribute 'Baadshaho' nationally|publisher=}}</ref>|CineKorn Entertainment}} | released = {{Film date|2017|9|1|df=y|ref1=<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Ajay-Devgn-announces-the-release-date-of-Baadshaho-with-a-philosophical-message/articleshow/55871887.cms"Ajay|title=Devgn announces Baadshaho release date|publisher=}}</ref>|Worldwide}} | runtime = 136 minutes<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/baadshaho-film|title=BAADSHAHO - BBFC|date=1 September 2017|publisher=[[BBFC]]}}</ref> | language = Hindi | budget = {{INR}}90 crore<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficeindia.com/movie.php?movieid=3590|title=Baadshaho - Movie - Box Office India|website=www.boxofficeindia.com}}</ref>{{better source|reason=Box Office India includes print and advertising costs in its budget figures, which is not done anywhere else.|date=February 2020}} | gross = {{Estimation}} {{INR}}123.50 crore<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/box-office-special-features/box-office-worldwide-collections-day-wise-break-baadshaho/|title=Box Office: Worldwide collections and day wise break up of Baadshaho}}</ref> }}
'''''Baadshaho''''' ({{translation|Kings}}) is a 2017 Indian [[Hindi]]-language [[period film|period]] [[action thriller film]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2017/06/20/ajay-devgn-fans-swamp-baadshaho-teaser-with-5-million-youtube-views/|title=Ajay Devgn Fans Swamp 'Baadshaho' Teaser With 5 Million Youtube Views|first=Rob|last=Cain|publisher=}}</ref> written by [[Rajat Arora]], and directed and co-produced by [[Milan Luthria]]. It features [[Ajay Devgn]], [[Ileana D'Cruz]], [[Emraan Hashmi]], [[Vidyut Jammwal]], [[Esha Gupta]] and [[Sanjay Mishra (actor)|Sanjay Mishra]] in the lead roles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/ileana-dcruz-i-cant-kiss-ass-to-get-work-maybe-that-put-a-speed-breaker-in-my-career/articleshow/60209472.cms|title=Ileana D'Cruz: The idea of dropping the jacket in Baadshaho was mine}}</ref> The film is set in the [[The Emergency (India)|emergency era of 1975-77]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/ajay-devgn-emraan-hashmi-team-up-for-milan-luthrias-film-set-in-emergency-period-2869237/|title=Ajay Devgn, Emraan Hashmi team up for Milan Luthria’s film set in Emergency period|date=22 June 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
The film released worldwide on 1 September 2017.
==Plot== In 1973 , Maharani Gitanjali ([[Ileana D'Cruz]]) is a princess to a royal family in Rajasthan. As every royal family has loads of gold to themselves, so does this royal family, but her ancestors did not hand it over to the government of the country even after the ancestral reign was over. In 1975, the then Prime Minister of India, Indira Gandhi declared the state of emergency in the country. Around the same time, Sanjeev ([[Priyanshu Chatterjee]]), an influential person in the Congress government, had been snubbed badly by Gitanjali in 1973 .To seek revenge, Sanjeev asks army officer Colonel Rudra Pratap Singh ([[Denzil Smith]]) to confiscate all the gold in Gitanjali’s possession and to put her behind bars. Rudra follows Sanjeev’s instructions and imprisons Gitanjali after forcibly taking possession of the gold rightfully belonging to the government but still held by her.
Rudra asks his trusted lieutenants, Major Seher Singh ([[Vidyut Jammwal]]) and Captain Somesh to transfer all the gold to Delhi safely to the government and for that, he gives Seher Singh a custom-made truck with a powerful safe in it, in which he keeps all the confiscated gold. As Rudra and Seher Singh are discussing, Sanjana ([[Esha Gupta]]), Gitanjali’s trusted aide, is sent by her to eavesdrop their conversation and get a whiff of their plan. Gitanjali then plans an entire scheme and wants Sanjana to accompany Bhawani Singh ([[Ajay Devgn]]) in getting all the gold back and eventually release her from the jail.
Gitanjali briefs Bhawani Singh, her trusted lieutenant, about the gold and how she needs it all back to look after the people in her village. The loyal Bhawani Singh promises to retrieve the gold and return the same to Gitanjali with whom he shares a romantic relationship.
Bhawani Singh with the support of Daliya ([[Emraan Hashmi]]) and Guruji ([[Sanjay Mishra (actor)|Sanjay Mishra]]), besides Sanjana, of course, chalk out an entire plan and seek out on a mission. The four follow the truck in which Seher Singh and his deputy, Somesh (Arjun Dwivedi), are carrying the gold to the Delhi. The group of four, at one point in the journey, takes control of the truck after throwing out Seher Singh and Somesh. The job now is to open the strong safe, something at which Guruji is adept. Meanwhile, Seher Singh, boss Rudra Pratap Singh and other army and police officers are hot on the trail of Bhawani Singh and the truck. At one point, the army officers seek the help of police officer Durjan (Sharad Kelkar) but Bhawani Singh and his team members outwit him too.
But before Bhawani Singh can return the gold to Gitanjali Devi, a very shocking revelation is unveiled in front of him, that Gitanjali used him for her personal pleasure and motives, and that Seher was her aide. Bhawani reveals that he already knew dark truth about Gitanjali and his team decided to distribute gold among poor people. After the war between Seher and Bhawani’s team ends, Gitanjali realised that she is alone in the desert with a low chance of survival while Bhawani and his team have escaped.
==Cast== *[[Ajay Devgn]] as Bhavani Singh *[[Ileana D'Cruz]] as Rani Gitanjali Devi (a character based on [[Gayatri Devi]])<ref>{{citation |title=Before Baadshaho reviews: Who was Maharani Gayatri Devi? |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/celebrities/story/who-was-maharani-gayatri-devi-baadshaho-1035070-2017-08-31 |work=[[India Today]] |date=31 August 2017 }}</ref> *[[Emraan Hashmi]] as Dalia *[[Esha Gupta]] as Sanjana *[[Vidyut Jammwal]] as Army Officer Major Seher Singh *[[Sanjay Mishra (actor)|Sanjay Mishra]] as Tikla aka Guruji *[[Priyanshu Chatterjee]] as Sanjay Kumar Mishra (politician) *[[Sharad Kelkar]] as Police Inspector Durjan *[[Lankesh Bhardwaj]] as Supdt. Meena *[[Adil Hussain]] as Officer *[[Denzil Smith]] as Rudra Singh *[[Ravi Kale]] as Babu Moshai *Aishmita Meena as Village Lady *[[Sunny Leone]] as an [[item number|item girl]] in the song "Piya More"
==Production== ===Development=== In January 2015, Ajay Devgn signed [[Milan Luthria]]'s ''Baadshaho'', marking his fourth collaboration with the director after ''[[Kachche Dhaage]]'' (1999), ''[[Chori Chori (2003 film)|Chori Chori]]'' (2003) and ''[[Once Upon a Time in Mumbai]]'' (2010).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Milan-Luthria-to-direct-Ajay-Devgn-in-Baadshaho/articleshow/45898755.cms"Milan|title=Luthria to direct Abhishek Singh in Baadshaho|publisher=}}</ref> This was the third collaboration of Emraan Hashmi with the director after ''Once Upon A Time In Mumbai'' and ''[[The Dirty Picture]]'' (2012). Luthria stated that besides directing he was also co-producing the film along with [[Bhushan Kumar]]'s [[T-Series (company)|T-Series]]. [[Ankit Tiwari]] was music director.<ref>[http://www.deccanchronicle.com/bollywood/160116/bhushan-kumar-and-milan-luthria-roped-in-ankit-tiwari-for-a-song-in-baadshaho.html"Bhushan Kumar and Milan Luthria roped in Ankit Tiwari for a song in Baadshaho"]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-is-ash-gayatri-devi-in-baadshaho-2201802|title=Is Ash Gayatri Devi in Baadshaho?|date=14 April 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
===Casting=== [[File:Ajay Devgn, Ileana D'Cruz.jpg|thumb|right|[[Ajay Devgn]] and [[Ileana D'Cruz]], during trailer launch of ''Baadshaho'']] Actresses [[Aishwarya Rai]], [[Kareena Kapoor]], [[Katrina Kaif]], [[Shruti Hassan]] and [[Priyanka Chopra]] were speculated as the lead actress opposite [[Ajay Devgn]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-i-m-in-talks-2207429%22Aishwarya|title=dna|website=dna}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/kareena-kapoor-khan-not-doing-ajay-devgn-starrer-baadshaho/|title=Kareena Kapoor Khan not doing Ajay Devgn starrer ‘Baadshaho’|date=23 March 2016|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/shruti-haasan-paired-opposite-ajay-devgn-in-baadshaho/|title=Shruti Haasan to star with Ajay Devgn in "Baadshaho"|date=22 July 2015|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-priyanka-chopra-in-badshaaho-2190633|title=Priyanka Chopra to star with Ajay Devgn and Vidyut Jammwal in Badshaaho?|date=18 March 2016|publisher=}}</ref> Though Kareena Kapoor and Katrina Kaif liked the script, they declined the offer due to non-availability.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/milan-luthria-reveals-that-he-approached-kareena-kapoor-khan-and-katrina-kaif-for-ileana-dcruzs-role-in-baadshaho/articleshow/60119831.cms"Milan|title=Luthria reveals that he approached Kareena Kapoor Khan and Katrina Kaif for Ileana D'Cruz's role in 'Baadshaho'|publisher=}}</ref> The film was to star [[Diljit Dosanjh]] initially, though he opted out of the project subsequently and was replaced by [[Emraan Hashmi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-emraan-hashmi-replaces-diljit-dosanjh-in-ajay-devgn-s-baadshaho-2225568|title=Emraan Hashmi replaces Diljit Dosanjh in Ajay Devgn's 'Baadshaho'|date=20 June 2016|publisher=}}</ref>
Later in June 2016, actors [[Vidyut Jammwal]], [[Ileana D'Cruz]] and [[Esha Gupta]] were officially confirmed to be in the cast.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-ajay-devgn-and-emraan-hashmi-team-up-once-again-for-milan-luthria-s-baadshaho-2226508%22Ajay|title=dna|website=dna}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Baadshaho-to-go-on-floors-in-August/articleshow/52865034.cms"'Baadshaho'|title=to go on floors in August|publisher=}}</ref> [[Priyanshu Chatterjee]] was cast in a special appearance for the role of the politician Sanjeev, modelled after [[Sanjay Gandhi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/baadshaho-review-kaun-banega-con/article19600789.ece|title=Baadshaho review: Kaun banega con?}}</ref> In August 2016, [[Sunny Leone]] was signed in for a special appearance in a song.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Sunny-Leone-to-groove-with-Ajay-Devgn-in-Baadshaho/articleshow/53633130.cms"Sunny|title=Leone to groove with Ajay Devgn in 'Baadshaho'|publisher=}}</ref>
===Filming=== [[Principal photography]] commenced on 15 August 2016 in [[Mumbai]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/milan-luthrias-ajay-devgn-emraan-hashmi-starrer-baadshaho-goes-on-floors-2993560/|title=Milan Luthria’s Ajay Devgn, Emraan Hashmi-starrer Baadshaho goes on floors|date=24 August 2016|publisher=}}</ref> The second schedule started on 1 December 2016 in [[Jodhpur]], [[Rajasthan]].<ref>[http://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/bollywood/021216/ajay-devgn-and-emraan-hashmi-rekindle-old-bonhomie-in-jodhpur-for-baadshaho.html"Ajay Devgn and Emraan Hashmi rekindle old bonhomie in Jodhpur for Baadshah hoo"]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Milan-Luthrias-next-will-have-Rajasthan-as-its-major-backdrop/articleshow/53170233.cms"Milan|title=Luthria’s next will have Rajasthan as its major backdrop|publisher=}}</ref> The third schedule commenced on 19 January 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-ajay-devgn-resumes-shooting-for-baadshaho-2294317%22Ajay|title=dna|website=dna}}</ref>
[[Ileana D'Cruz]] wrapped her part of filming on 5 March 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/ileana-dcruz-baadshaho-was-incredibly-special/articleshow/57476215.cms"Ileana|title=D'Cruz: 'Baadshaho' was incredibly special|publisher=}}</ref> The Rajasthan schedule was wrapped up on 9 March 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.news18.com/news/movies/baadshaho-ajay-devgn-completes-rajasthan-shooting-schedule-1358090.html"Baadshaho:|title=Ajay Devgn Completes Rajasthan Shooting Schedule|publisher=}}</ref>
==Release and Marketing == The makers earlier announced their worldwide release as 26 January 2017. However, upon the request from producers [[Ritesh Sidhwani]] and [[Rakesh Roshan]] of the films ''[[Raees (film)|Raees]]'' and ''[[Kaabil]]'' respectively, Bhushan Kumar moved the worldwide release date to 12 May 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-ajay-devgn-s-baadshaho-stays-clear-of-raees-kaabil-box-office-clash-2232999|title=Ajay Devgn's 'Baadshaho' stays clear of Raees-Kaabil box office clash|date=10 July 2016|publisher=}}</ref> In early December 2016, Devgn announced 1 September 2017 as the worldwide release date.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Ajay-Devgn-announces-the-release-date-of-Baadshaho-with-a-philosophical-message/articleshow/55871887.cms|title=Ajay Devgn announces the release date of 'Baadshaho' with a philosophical message - Times of India ►|publisher=}}</ref>
==Soundtrack== {{Infobox album | name = Baadshaho | type = [[Soundtrack]] | artist = [[Rahul Dev Burman]], [[Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan]], [[Tanishk Bagchi]], [[Ankit Tiwari]], [[Abhijit Vaghani]], DJ Chetas and Traditional Folk | cover = | alt = | released = {{Start date|df=y|2017|08|19}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Feature film soundtrack]] | length = 30:52 | language = [[Hindi language|Hindi]] | label = [[T-Series (company)|T-Series]] | producer = | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{External media | audio1 = {{YouTube|vPbRQ-BEb88|Audio Jukebox}}}} }} The soundtrack was released on 19 August 2017 by [[T-Series (company)|T-Series]], which consists of eight songs, composed by [[Tanishk Bagchi]], [[Ankit Tiwari]], Abhijit Vaghani, DJ Chetas and Traditional Folk. The songs "Mere Rashke Qamar" and "Socha Hai" ("Kehdoon Tumhe" from the 1975 film ''[[Deewaar]]'') are recreations for the film by lyricist [[Manoj Muntashir]] and composer Tanishk Bagchi. Their originals were written by Fana Buland Shehri and [[Sahir Ludhianvi]], and were composed by [[Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan]] and [[R. D. Burman]] respectively.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.com/entertainment/hindi/music/news/baadshaho-new-song-ajay-devgn-ileana-dcruzs-mere-rashke-qamar-is-a-musical-delight/articleshow/59591766.cms|title='Baadshaho' new song: Ajay Devgn-Ileana D'cruz's 'Mere Rashke Qamar' is a musical delight|date=14 July 2017|accessdate=14 July 2017|work=The Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/baadshaho-song-mere-rashke-qamar-ajay-devgn-ileana-dcruz-romance-and-nusrat-fateh-ali-khans-voice-make-it-special-watch-video-4750079/|title=Baadshaho song Mere Rashke Qamar: Ajay Devgn-Ileana D'Cruz romance and Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan's voice make it special.|date=14 July 2017|accessdate=14 July 2017|work=The Indian Express|author=Arushi Jain}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/baadshaho-song-piya-more-launch-sunny-leone-emraan-hashmi-twitter-chat-4764977/|title=Baadshaho song Piya More launch: Sunny Leone, Emraan Hashmi indulge in Twitter banter|date=24 July 2017|publisher=}}</ref> {{tracklist | headline = Track listing | extra_column = Singer(s) | total_length = 30:52 | title1 = [[Mere Rashke Qamar#2017 film version|Mere Rashke Qamar]] | all_lyrics=[[Manoj Muntashir]] | music1 = [[Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan]], [[Tanishk Bagchi]] | extra1 = Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, [[Rahat Fateh Ali Khan]] | length1 = 3:40 | title2 = [[Piya More]] | music2 = [[Ankit Tiwari]] | extra2 = [[Mika Singh]], [[Neeti Mohan]] | length2 = 4:17 | title3 = Socha Hai | music3 = [[R. D. Burman]], Tanishk Bagchi | extra3 = [[Kishore Kumar]], [[Jubin Nautiyal]], Neeti Mohan, [[Asha Bhosle]] | length3 = 2:50 | title4 = Hoshiyar Rehna | note4 = Traditional lyrics | music4 = Traditional Folk | extra4 = Neeraj Arya's Kabir Café | length4 = 4:07 | title5 = Mere Rashke Qamar | note5 = Version 2 | extra5 = [[Tulsi Kumar]] | music5 = Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, Tanishk Bagchi | length5 = 3:41 | title6 = Socha Hai | note6 = 2nd Version | extra6 = Jubin Nautiyal, Neeti Mohan | music6 = R. D. Burman, Tanishk Bagchi | length6 = 4:13 | title7 = Mere Rashke Qamar | note7 = Remix | extra7 = Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan, Rahat Fateh Ali Khan | music7 = Tanishk Bagchi, '''Remix by:''' DJ Chetas | length7 = 3:36 | title8 = Socha Hai | note8 = Love Version | extra8 = Jubin Nautiyal, Neeti Mohan | music8 = R. D. Burman, Abhijit Vaghani | length8 = 4:28 }}
